instruction: How were the machine learning models used to analyze the spectral reflections of safflower plants and determine the effects of irrigation applications on yield quality?
Output: The machine learning models, specifically support vector machine, k-nearest neighbor, and decision tree, were used to analyze the spectral reflections of safflower plants and determine the effects of irrigation applications on yield quality. These models were applied to the feature vectors obtained from the reflections detained from safflower leaves using a spectroradiometer device. The first stage of the analysis involved providing the feature vector, which represents the different situations of safflower plants based on water ratio. In the second stage, the feature vector data was classified using the mentioned machine learning models. By comparing the performance of the three groups, the average value was found to be high, indicating the effectiveness of the machine learning models in analyzing the spectral reflections and determining the effects of irrigation applications on yield quality.
